Shane Wolfe.Action: Leads a team of five Navy SEALs in a coordinated underwater approach using jet propelled backpacks and equipment to attach a cable to a fleeing boat.
Fixes a bomb to the boat hull and disables the boat to stop hostile men.
Assures the Professor with a light comment about first round being on him at Virginia Beach before the escape.
Makes sure the terrified pilot can swim before tossing him out, indicating concern for the pilot's survival.
Operates with calm and efficiency under pressure, showing care for the Professor's safety during escape.
Communicates in perfect Serbian to coordinate and deceive hostile guards.
Successfully retrieves the Professor and briefcase underwater, showing physical and tactical skill.
Uses a retractable crossbow to shoot a cable and capture a helicopter, demonstrating quick thinking and precision.
Commands the helicopter by displacing the pilot and taking control, showing confidence and leadership.
Calmly reassures the terrified pilot with a simple question, showing situational control and emotional intelligence.
Does not hesitate or show fear in extremely dangerous, high-pressure situations.
Sticks the mouthpiece back in the Professor's mouth to shut him up, saying he's not big on chit chat.
Refuses Charles' request to call his wife, citing mission priority but allows him to speak the names of his kids into the briefcase.
Calmly silences the Professor by putting the mouth piece back on and instructs him to keep it on until reaching the rendezvous point, showing control and foresight.
Reads the situation and denies Charles' request to call his wife, prioritizing the mission and following strict orders despite emotional appeals.
Maintains a professional demeanor and keeps focus even when Charles mentions his family, only allowing a quick mention before moving on.
Expresses confusion/puzzlement when Charles shows how the briefcase voice activation works, suggesting a momentary gap in understanding advanced security tech.
Hands Charles his satellite phone to help him make a call despite difficult circumstances.
Reaches out and grabs the picture of Charles' kids during a dangerous explosion before going unconscious.
Accepts full responsibility for the mission's failure and shows regret for his lapse in judgment.
Expresses appreciation and gratitude for Bill's confidence in giving him another chance.
Accepts a difficult mission to protect a family despite discomfort with children.
Shows respect and sentimental attachment by carefully handling and pinning an old medal to his suit.
Double-checks the address before ringing the doorbell.
Maintains composure and looks confident despite a child rudely shutting the door in his face.
Salutes and formally introduces himself as 'Lieutenant Shane Wolfe' when meeting Julie.
Unsure how to respond to Julie's hug, showing some social awkwardness.
Nods hello to the Romanian maid carrying a baby.
Greets the children with a stern nod rather than a warm greeting.
Tells Julie she has a pleasant family, acknowledging her situation respectfully.
Stands 'at ease' but does not look relaxed or friendly, suggesting formal distance.
Reassures Julie by saying nothing will happen to her family while he is there.
Responds cautiously yet politely to the duck nibbling his ear and follows Julie's preference to call her by her first name.
Immediately begins securing the perimeter and protecting the family with careful and thorough surveillance actions, showing dedication and protectiveness.
Leaves quickly after exchange, without further personal interaction or display of emotional connection.
Immediately takes initiative to secure the perimeter, sets up surveillance cameras, contact alarms, taps phones, uses ear transmitter, and employs night vision goggles to monitor the property.
Responds rapidly and professionally even after a momentary distraction by the duck, maintains vigilance.
Reassures Julie that the kids will be safe with him.
Reassures Julie about the safety of the children and accepts responsibility confidently.
Proactively installs a surveillance camera in the house.
Leaps off the ladder and quickly responds to Lulu's screams, showing attentiveness and concern.
Shakes his head disapprovingly at Lulu playing a noisy video game but speaks calmly.
Expresses concern upon not hearing the baby crying and actively looks for him.
Scowls at Helga for running a loose ship, indicating frustration but does not escalate conflict.
Takes initiative to sneak out and confront an intruder in the backyard, showing protective behavior.
Engages physically but carefully with the intruder, revealing identity without aggression.
Quickly leaps off ladder and rushes downstairs upon hearing gunfire sounds, showing prompt reaction and physical capability.
Notices disorderly behavior with children and admonishes Helga about running a loose ship, demonstrating situational awareness and authority.
Silently turns off alarm and sneakily exits to investigate a suspicious figure, showing tactical stealth and initiative.
Chases and subdues the intruder by jumping on trampoline and tackling him, displaying physical skill and effective capture.
Shakes his head at Lulu and attempts to lower the video game volume but is interrupted, indicating some limitations in controlling chaotic environment.
Tells Zoe to go back inside and handles the intruder Scott firmly but without cruelty.
Playfully corrects Scott's misunderstanding about a payment by ordering push-ups instead.
Physically lifts and spins Scott away like a marionette to remove him from the premises.
Apologizes politely and in Korean to the neighbors for the alarm disturbance.
Immediately stops the alarm when asked by neighbors.
Correctly identifies the intruder and takes charge of the situation by ordering Scott to do push-ups instead of giving money.
Calmly deals with an angry neighbor couple in their native language to ease tensions.
Efficiently disables the loud alarm with a remote control.
Initially assumes the neighbors don't speak English and addresses them in Korean, which turns out unnecessary.
Snaps a photo of Chun's car in the driveway, possibly for surveillance or control purposes.
Confronts Zoe about not telling her mother the truth, showing concern for her safety.
Physically restrains Zoe when she tries to kick him, but then carefully helps her down the hall on one foot, preventing her from falling.
Shuts Zoe in her room and denies her plans to go out, enforcing strict control.
Bangs on Todd's door to impose a 'lights out' rule despite resistance.
Takes a photo of the Chun's car in their driveway, possibly for evidence or monitoring.
Skillfully catches Zoe's kicking foot and manages to control her without causing harm.
Enforces rules decisively by shutting Zoe in her room and ordering Todd to lights out despite resistance.
Shows patience and continued perseverance despite Todd's rude response.
Wakes the children early with a loud trumpet and boom box, forcing them to get up despite their protests and discomfort.
Tells Helga not to curse in front of the kids, trying to maintain a respectful environment.
Responds to Helga's disbelief by cursing back in Romanian, surprising her.
Delivers a strict, authoritarian speech to the children emphasizing discipline and order, declaring everything must be done his way.
Straps security bracelets with tracking and panic buttons on the children, stating distrust and enforcing strict control.
Yells at Zoe in a commanding, authoritarian manner, insisting on obedience and chain of command.
Breaks down Todd's locked door by donkey kicking it, showing little respect for privacy.
Offers a lighthearted comment about fixing the door despite the damage caused.
Gives Todd his bracelet back and points out Todd's mistake to encourage responsibility.
Uses military-style authority and chain of command to control the children, clearly stating expectations.
Forcefully kicks down Todd's locked door to enforce compliance, showing decisiveness and physical capability.
Suffers minor physical setback (hit by falling debris) and shows embarrassment, but recovers quickly and continues to manage the situation.
Comments on fixing the door optimistically despite causing serious damage, implying confidence in problem-solving.
Snaps the bracelet onto Todd's wrist and subtly reprimands him, reinforcing rules intelligently.

Engages playfully and attentively with the children, showing interest in their fears and stories like the ghost.
Simultaneously does one-handed push ups while loading a photo into his laptop, showing multitasking and focus.
Responds quickly to the sound of an approaching car by rushing to the door and securing the alarm.
Calmly handles the unexpected morning paper thrown at his face without losing composure.
Encourages Lulu to be brave when she is scared, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Begins to actively investigate the claim of a ghost by carefully scanning the environment with his hands.
Fails to notice Todd and Zoe's sabotage with cooking oil while patrolling the hall.
Raps on the wall and listens for hollow spaces to detect something hidden, then redirects focus to his laptop when alerted.
Tries to block Helga from leaving, grabs her suitcase and drags her back to prevent her quitting
Blocks Helga's exit, grabs her suitcase, picks up the phone to intervene and prevent her from leaving, physically grabs her foot to drag her back.
Lets Helga go after she bites him and struggles, shows patience.
Chases after Helga and tries to call her back, showing concern.
Responds to rejection (Helga leaving) with disbelief but does not lash out, then calmly returns inside.
Picks up the crying baby awkwardly but attempts to care.
Chases Helga after she leaves despite the chaotic struggle and tries to assert command.
Is caught off guard by Helga’s escape and obscene gesture, showing momentary defeat and disbelief.
Recovers quickly from defeat, takes a deep breath, and confidently strides back inside to face his responsibilities.
Awkwardly picks up the crying baby, showing some unfamiliarity but willingness to act.

Tries to reassure the kids about their mother's delayed return and encourages them to have fun.
Uses playful language and humor to engage with the kids despite feeling overwhelmed.
Quickly moves the baby away after a messy incident, showing self-preservation but no assistance received from others.

Picks up the baby and dips the bottom half in the toilet, then flushes repeatedly.
Patrols hall to make sure all the doors and windows are locked, looking out for safety.

Does not react defensively or lose composure in the face of Vice Principal Murney's aggressive and dismissive attitude.

Reacts with surprise to Principal Claire's Navy SEAL tattoo, showing some uncertainty or lack of immediate recognition of the significance.

Watches kids through binoculars, noting who is ignoring or glaring at him.
Sternly commands Tyler to eat, showing seriousness but care for child's wellbeing.
Disguises himself by blending into the school environment unnoticed.

Observes students carefully through binoculars, gathering intel while maintaining cover.
Commands firmly and confidently when trying to get Tyler to eat despite distractions.

Makes a funny face to stop Tyler from crying, making him laugh.

Makes a funny face to stop Tyler from crying, causing Tyler to laugh.
Successfully keeps all three Plummer kids out of trouble for a whole day, impressing Principal Claire.

Pushes through the crowd confidently to address the situation with authority.
Judo flips Todd effortlessly, demonstrating unexpected skill and control.

Declines the invitation to wrestling practice politely but firmly, maintaining professional focus on his duty.
Puts arm over Todd's shoulder showing an attempt at camaraderie.
Reacts with disgust and panic when needing to change Tyler's diaper, then tries to pass the responsibility to the Principal.
Handles multiple children despite exhaustion, showing responsibility and tolerance.
Shows frustration but complies when asked to change Tyler’s diaper, despite obvious discomfort.

Responds immediately and decisively to an emergency alarm by handing off the children and pursuing the threat.

Pursues children at high speed, driving recklessly and kicking out plywood to get to them.
Lands in a fight stance in front of 2nd graders, implying readiness and control under pressure.

Kicks out a plywood wall section and charges through to confront multiple construction workers without hesitation.
Easily takes out three construction workers who rush him, demonstrating physical skill and confidence.
Uses a tracker to accurately locate the kids’ beepers and quickly follows their location to a manhole.
Removes a manhole cover and courageously lowers himself down into a dark, filthy sewer, showing determination and practical problem solving.
Wades through disgusting sludge without hesitation, continuing to track and follow the signals.
Dives underwater to retrieve homing beacons, demonstrating physical endurance and focus under difficult conditions.
Emerges covered in filth, causing others to react with surprise and disgust, indicating a lack of concern for personal appearance to achieve the goal.

Assumes leadership as den commander to help the Brownie troop sell cookies.
Uses a power drill to physically secure windows and doors to protect the girls.

Uses a power drill to screw shut windows and doors, demonstrating practical skill and thoroughness in securing the house.

Locks windows with drywall screws but leaves half-inch opening for air and ensures safety measures.
Loads the Brownies and toddlers into the minivan carefully with two Snuggles attached.

Secures windows by screwing them shut but leaves a half-inch opening for air, demonstrating caution and control.

Sets up a card table for the Brownies to sell cookies while monitoring them via closed-circuit monitor.

Runs to check on the kids immediately after his monitor beeps, showing concern.

Takes lead in managing the Brownies and agrees to take them to dinner despite his evident discomfort, showing tolerance and responsibility.

Screams and rips the joystick off the arcade machine after losing, then sneaks away to avoid getting caught.
Barks orders at the Brownies like Marines: 'Move, move, move! Go go!'

Charges across the room with the diaper and commands others to clear the way, demonstrating leadership and decisiveness.

Groans in disbelief at the chaotic party but immediately takes control by guiding the children away from danger.

Responds to hostility from Zoe by listening silently and accepting criticism, shows restraint and does not retaliate.
Admits to not being the right person for the job when faced with emotional turmoil from the kids.
Notices the home-burned CD labeled 'GHOST' and quickly takes it with him, indicating alertness and initiative.
Works his way through the spotless house, showing attention to detail and situational awareness.

Fights off ninjas to protect the children despite being outnumbered and injured.

Hugs the kids with genuine emotion, reassures them he is not leaving.

Intervenes by offering to reveal the code to prevent harm to the children, pleads for no one to be hurt.

Lies incapacitated on the concrete, presumably having been defeated or captured prior to this scene.

Kicks Bill's gun away at the critical moment, preventing Bill from using it and showing quick reflexes and presence of mind.

Steps forward to reach the safe before Bill does, showing confidence and initiative.

Remains composed and confident despite chaotic hostage situation, ultimately seizes the rocket launcher from the antagonist.

Examines FBI business card, swelling with pride.

Surprises Lulu with a bear hug, hugs the whole family at once, showing physical affection and care.
Gives Zoe his medal, saying it should go to someone he cares about, showing trust and appreciation.
Expresses sincere emotions openly, bawling and wiping his face, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Reassures Lulu he will see her soon and commits to Friday night plans, showing reliability and friendliness.
Motivates and encourages the cast before their performance with high expectations but a grin, showing supportive leadership.
Cheering enthusiastically and proudly for the children's performance, stands and shouts encouragement.
Humbly accepting applause and flowers, showing genuine appreciation.
Organizes and leads a military-style version of a musical, resulting in a standing ovation and audience admiration.
Shows pride and enthusiasm in the performance, standing and shouting to encourage a performer, demonstrating confidence and leadership.
Rises out of the water to save the Professor, calmly reassures him, and instructs clearly for his safety.
Rises calmly out of the water under dire circumstances, rescues Professor Plummer and quickly assesses the situation to secure the briefcase, demonstrates confidence and control.
Commands the Professor clearly with specific instructions to follow exactly, showing leadership and assertiveness.
Does not panic despite the rising water level and danger, manages to provide oxygen to the Professor while maintaining focus.
Responds to being shut out by a child with a frown but remains composed and respectful.
Salutes Julie politely and introduces himself formally despite the awkward first impression.
Appears unsure how to respond to Julie's hug, described as a rock who doesn't flinch.
Wakes the kids early with loud music and physical intervention despite their protests.
Shows strong confidence and assertiveness by pushing the children to wake up and take action.
Does not consider the children's emotional state or morning routines, possibly undermining his approach.
Casually holds the three kids while the principal watches, calmly organizing teens to get to class.
Politely interacts with Principal Claire, showing respect and sharing a moment of connection over Navy service tattoos.
Requests permission to stay and watch over the kids, showing responsibility and consideration.
Uses toys creatively and non-lethally to fend off attackers, avoiding serious harm.
After the fight, quietly approaches Zoe's door and reassures the kids their safety.
Uses toys and household items creatively as weapons to fend off multiple Ninjas, improvising effectively during the fight.
Recognizes the Ninjas are barefoot and exploits this by scattering Legos and Jacks on the floor to hinder their movement.
Blinds a Ninja with Desitin by aggressively squeezing and throwing it, using available resources smartly.
Kicks a Ninja through a window showing physical capability and confidence in combat.
Gets temporarily blinded by baby powder sprayed in his face, loses sight of the Ninjas who escape.
After losing the Ninjas, composes himself quickly and proceeds cautiously to check on the kids, indicating emotional control and situational awareness.
Quickly adapts by using a small girl's bicycle to chase after a suspect, showing resourcefulness and physical stamina.
Observes and follows a suspicious group stealthily into a dangerous location, showing tactical patience and caution.
Promises he won't touch the child, showing respect for boundaries.
Tucks Lulu into bed and tells her an imaginative story to comfort her.
Shows emotional vulnerability with tears while telling the story.
Organizes a homecoming surprise for Julie with the kids, creating a warm, welcoming environment.
Keeps the kids well-groomed and disciplined, presenting them as a picture-perfect family.
Salutes Bill with pride and respect, showing sincerity and trustworthiness.
Confidently leads the group in the secret vault, engaging the children by using their names as the key to the puzzle.
Calls the kids heroes and defends them to the police, suggesting they call the FBI.
Grins broadly after the woman disarms the attacker, shares a proud smile with her.
Modestly replies 'Just doing my job' when praised by the FBI agent.
Gives a heartfelt medal to Zoe, showing thoughtful delegation and emotional intelligence.
Expresses strong emotional vulnerability openly, bawling in front of the family.
Reassures Lulu confidently about future plans despite others' doubts.
Demonstrates clear leadership and motivational skills backstage, emphasizing attention to detail and high standards.
